sentences.sContent: The judge cited a 1956 Supreme Court ruling in her decision.
sentences.sCn: 法官在她的判决中引用了1956年最高法院的一项裁决。

sentences.sContent: The passage cited above is from a Robert Frost poem.
sentences.sCn: 以上的引文出自罗伯特•弗罗斯特的一首诗。

sentences.sContent: She was cited in the divorce proceedings.
sentences.sCn: 她在离婚诉讼中被传唤。

sentences.sContent: ...services are springing up to make it easier to publish research products online and enable other researchers to discover and cite them...
...You may cite some examples support you view...
...A prime example Schweitzer and his colleagues cite is the 2004 collapse of energy-trading giant Enron...
...The third rule is to be ready to cite options and consequences...

remMethod.val: 和bite(v. 咬)一起记， 家里的狗咬了人， 所以被传讯

words.tran: 引用，引证；[法] 传票；褒扬

trans.tranCn: 引证；引用；〔法院〕传召，传讯
trans.tranOther: to mention something as an example, especially one that supports, proves, or explains an idea or situation
